introduction.para:
The Plugin Command Stub is the managed class that implements the T:Jacobi.Vst.Core.Plugin.IVstPluginCommandStub interface. That class must be public in the managed Plugin assembly in order for the
to load it and pass it to the . The Plugin Command Stub receives calls on its methods from the Plugin Command Proxy and dispatches them inside the managed Plugin. If you use the framework assembly to help with your implementation, its very easy to implement the Plugin Command Stub. If you program at Core level, only using the core assembly, you have to implement all these methods (almost 60!) yourself.

content.para: When using the framework assembly for your managed Plugin, you can take advantage of the provided Plugin Command Stub. The T:Jacobi.Vst.Framework.Plugin.StdPluginCommandStub base class dispatches all calls to the (optional) interfaces a Plugin can implement. These interfaces are all discovered through the T:Jacobi.Vst.Framework.IExtensible interface on the .

When an interface is not supported by a Plugin implementation the stub returns a value that indicates this. If the Plugin does support the interface in question it is retrieved through the M:Jacobi.Vst.Framework.IExtensible.GetInstance method and the appropriate method on that interface is called. Most of the calls on the framework interfaces are more or less the same as the methods on the IVstPluginCommandStub interface, there some exception however, where the framework adds an abstraction to provide a clearer mechanism for the developer. ,
and
are at a higher level of abstraction than the underlying VST types.
